description: Keying incident at Dallas-Fort Worth Airport: A Tesla’s cameras recorded a man keying the car’s paint in the parking lot around 4:15 PM. The owner filed a police report and posted the video online, which went viral (even retweeted by Donald Trump Jr.). Police are investigating, and the incident highlights growing anti-Tesla sentiment.
screenshotLinks: Viral video of suspect keying the Tesla

description: Serial graffiti attacks: A 42-year-old suspect vandalized a Tesla dealership multiple times. She spray-painted 'Nazi' under the entrance sign and on 15 vehicles. Lucy Grace Nelson was arrested in February and charged with malicious destruction of property.
screenshotLinks: Surveillance images in DOJ complaint

description: Nazi spray-paint on Tesla dealership sign.
Nazi spray-paint on 15 Tesla vehicles.
Anti-Musk graffiti: After a protest at a Tesla dealership, police found 'No Musk' scrawled with a swastika on the building.
screenshotLinks: Police photos of graffiti

description: Stickers on vehicles: A 39-year-old man placed stickers of Elon Musk’s face on several Teslas, calling it 'free speech.' He was charged with six counts of defacing property.
screenshotLinks: Photos of Musk stickers on cars

description: Hate graffiti on Cybertrucks: Six Tesla Cybertrucks at a Seattle-area dealership were spray-painted with swastikas and profanities directed at Elon Musk.
screenshotLinks: Images of swastikas on Cybertrucks

description: A Cybertruck exploded outside the Trump International.
screenshotLinks: imgur

description: Molotov cocktail attacks (series): Over five late-Jan to Feb incidents, a suspect hurled Molotov cocktails at a Tesla dealership, igniting small fires.
screenshotLinks: Surveillance footage of Molotov attacks

description: Molotov cocktails thrown at Tesla dealership.
Attempted arson: Incendiary devices targeting Tesla dealership.
Charging stations torched: Seven Tesla Supercharger stalls at a shopping center outside Boston were set on fire overnight.
screenshotLinks: Photos of charred charging stalls

description: Molotov attack & arrest: A 24-year-old man threw incendiary devices at a Tesla charging station and accidentally set himself on fire.
screenshotLinks: Security camera still of suspect with Molotov

description: Copycat fire: A month after the original Loveland attacks, an arson fire was reported at the same Tesla center.
screenshotLinks: Local news image of fire damage

description: Fire caused by incendiary devices at Tesla dealership, vehicles/building damaged.
screenshotLinks: Screenshot

description: Mysterious lot fire: A blaze destroyed four Tesla Cybertrucks parked at a Tesla lot in Seattle.
screenshotLinks: Burned Tesla trucks in Seattle lot

description: Firebombing of service center: In a pre-dawn attack, a Tesla Collision Center was set ablaze with Molotov cocktails and marked with 'RESIST' graffiti. At least five cars were damaged, with gunfire also reported.
screenshotLinks: LVMPD released CCTV of fire

description: Cybertrucks burned: Two Tesla Cybertrucks were found burned at a Kansas City Tesla dealership lot in a likely arson incident.
screenshotLinks: Local news video of KC fire

description: Shots fired at dealership: Around 3:00 AM, an assailant fired multiple rounds into a Tesla dealership’s building and at least one vehicle.
screenshotLinks: Salem PD photos: bullet-pierced window

description: Drive-by shooting (1st incident): At ~5 AM, 7–8 gunshots were fired into a Tesla showroom in Tigard, hitting three cars and shattering windows.
screenshotLinks: Tigard PD image of shattered glass

description: Drive-by shooting (2nd incident): One week after the first, the Tigard Tesla store was attacked again before dawn with 10–15 shots, causing extensive damage.
screenshotLinks: Tigard dealership with bullet holes, boarded windows

description: ICE-ing protest: Pickup truck owners deliberately blocked access to Tesla Supercharger stalls, shouting 'F*** Tesla!' while preventing Tesla drivers from charging.
screenshotLinks: Reddit photo of trucks blocking chargers

description: Charger blocking & pranks: A Dodge Ram pickup was parked in a Tesla charging spot with the Supercharger cable mockingly draped into its bed.
screenshotLinks: Photo of truck 'ICE-ing' with charger cable in bed

description: Supercharger cables stolen: Thieves cut and stole 18 out of 19 charging cables at a Tesla Supercharger station in one night.
screenshotLinks: Photo: severed charging cables strewn on ground

description: Demonstration at Tesla dealership with nine arrests for disorderly conduct.
'Tesla Takedown' rally: Over 350 protesters gathered outside the Tesla showroom, occupying it and forcing a shutdown. NYPD arrested 6 people.
screenshotLinks: Reuters photo – crowd protesting outside NYC Tesla store

description: Coordinated nationwide protests: Hundreds protested at Tesla dealerships across multiple states, with peaceful demonstrations and some minor scuffles.
screenshotLinks: AFP/Getty image – Pasadena, CA protest on 3/8/25

description: 'Rolling Coal' road harassment: A viral TeslaCam dashcam video showed a modified diesel pickup deliberately 'coal rolling' a Tesla twice on a highway.
screenshotLinks: Tesla dashcam clip of pickup emitting black smoke

description: Charger blocking & pranks: A Dodge Ram pickup was parked in a Tesla charging spot with the Supercharger cable mockingly draped into its bed (also listed under Theft & Sabotage).
screenshotLinks: Photo of truck 'ICE-ing' with charger cable in bed
